course_title: Senior Seminar: Building a Billion $ Company
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Mondays, 5:30-7:30pm - GBS 301
Class Dates:  10/30, 11/6, 11/13, 11/20, 11/27, alternate date: 12/4 (the alternate date is only used if the instructor or the school has an emergency that causes one of the scheduled dates to be canceled-it will not be held as a makeup date for a missed class).


Seminar Description:  For any student aspiring to build, join or invest in a landmark company, learn from CEOs currently tackling the issues faced at each phase.
  Session 1 - "From Inception to $10M"; Session 2 - "$10M to $100M"; Session 3 - "$100M to $250M"; Session 4 - "$250M to $750M"; Session 5 - "Breaking $1B and accelerating through it"  Format: The start of the class will be a speaker sharing learnings and issues at the specific stage, then as a class, we will tackle a case study covering a critical decision the CEO must make to succeed.
  Be ready to envision building a billion-dollar company and expect to be better prepared post seminar. You will also meet some of the best entrepreneurs in the Atlanta region.


Instructor:  Adam Marchick built three companies and received funding from nine Venture Capital firms. He serves as a Director at Emory' s Endowment, investing in Venture Capital funds on behalf of the University. Relevant experience includes scaling a company from $0 to $10M in revenue, securing lead funding from Sequoia Capital, and investing in over 40 start-ups.
course_description: Senior seminar courses fall outside the scope of traditional academic coursework, and instead allow students to learn from and interact with experienced practitioners, and to develop industry-specific insights, fine-tune career skills, and increase professional exposure.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the BBA program.
sections: Class Nbr: 6653, Section #: 1107, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 5:30-7:30p, Instructor: A. Hershatter, Status: Wait List
